channel.title: Global Warming!
channel.description:
Haven't brought this up lately, have we?
Anyway: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748704422204576130300992126630.html
Oh and the comments are pretty good: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748704422204576130300992126630.html#articleTabs_comments%3D%26articleTabs%3Dcomments
So yer, apparently weather patterns havent changed at all since 1871 and have shown nothing abnormal.

item.title: Global Warming!
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Radeon:

Wars, poverty, drugs, aids, cancer. Money is more worth spending on those issues.

The rich run the place, so poverty isn’t going to get shit any way you look at it. Too many people in power make money off war, and aids is for africans and homosexuals.

You may believe these are important issues, but the reality is that the people who make the decisions don’t.

Spending money on global warming is a great idea, but it’s a long term thing which lowers it’s priority, which is dumb but that’s how things work.

Read full topic

item.title: Global Warming!
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:10, topic:382156”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=477958.msg3499137#msg3499137 date=1297596245]
You know I don’t deny global warming, I just don’t think it’s worth spending billions on research for it when we have other more important problems to worry about.
[/quote]

Doing something about global warming means that we can improve the way we improve our energy supplies. Doing something about it means we don’t need oil and natural gas anymore. It’s pretty important, from every perspective.

What other things are as important, if I may ask?[/quote]

Wars, poverty, drugs, aids, cancer. Money is more worth spending on those issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Global Warming!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Honestly I’ve been on the fence about global warming ever since I last brought it up (going from a complete denier)

Even with any disproving evidence, when you think about burning vast amounts of fuel that hasn’t been touched in millions of years and kicking all of this C02 into the air it really is hard to believe that there are no side effects whatsoever.

Read full topic

item.title: Global Warming!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

im not going to dissect all of the article to frells relief but I will say this off the bat: its a fucking opinion piece, in other words NOT news, it’s comparable to any blogger with a few hundred thousand viewers, and it has no accountability if the article is biased(oh hey, this article is) or the article is wrong(again, this article is(partially))

since the author misrepresented what the 20CR is, the 20th century reanalysis project(20CR) is basically a set of observations and estimates of the climate atmosphere(specifically the troposphere) based on ground, sea and ice observations which is the standard(preeeeeeeeesumably) to compare climate models and findings to, dont understand? I dont either, this is the part a fucking news reporter would do the research, get the facts and check them and present them to you so you fucking dont have to but this isn’t a news article… but if you’re interested a paper about the 20CR can be found here: http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/qj.776/full

it’s important to note there are 2 versions of the 20CR,version 1 which is for the 1908-1958 period, while version 2 is data from 1871 to 2008, the article claims that the initial findings of the version 2 paper show there’s no apparent trend in extreme weather basically meaning any human action has no effect on extreme weather patterns

I was a little interested so I did a little research, the only scientific paper that I found related to 20CR which shows no apparent trend in any kind of extreme weather is this one, so what’s the problem? its based on the findings of the version 1 study so it only dates from 1908 to 1958

ill be blunt and say I think the author, intentionally or not, saw this article and assumed it was based on the 20CRv2s findings(since it references 20CRp) and assuming this is what happened the article would have no facts to back it up

ps sorry if dis post is hard to read my mind went to mush in the middle of writing it, and I rewrote it a few times so that didnt help

pps “Global-warming alarmists insist that economic activity is the problem, when the available evidence show it to be part of the solution.” oh fucking lawd how can anyone be that silly

ppps: tldr is shit no one cares about and I just wasted a few hours weeeeew

Read full topic
